item.title: Huge fun fair signage right outside our homes in the park - secured to the parks fence, 19th October
item.description:
This was put up in the middle of the night it seems and left there, they should not be allowed to advertise right outside of peoples homes. Its worse enough that the park gets taken over constantly by these awful fun fairs but the advertising should not have to affect our view and have to see this garish poster every time we look out of the window. There are places they can advertise that are not residential and with smaller signs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thicket Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti tags sprayed on large bin containers at 300 Brixton road SW9, 19th October
item.description:
I like to report graffiti tags sprayed on two large steel bin containers at 300 Brixton road SW9. They are located outside Bedswell House residential flats SW9. The tags have been there for several weeks. Please can the tags be jet-sprayed off the containers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 190, Brixton Road, Oval, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Councillor Chris Kennedy & mayor of Hackney gloating, appraising themselves about saving the bath house community center. Chris Kennedy & the mayor of hackney enjoying themselves at a day out at the sauna, spar. Councillor Chris Kennedy & the mayor of the borough of Hackney really work hard in your community trying to make it better for residents. Chris Kennedy & the mayor of Hackney do nothing about antisocial behavior / criminal activity in the neighborhood but they have time for leisure. Work and pleasure at the same time. These elected people do not serve the community in the right way and funding for right things many residents struggling in the borough of Hackney But they find funding and time to support bath house from closure. This bath house does not serve the whole community only a small number of people. The councillor Chris Kennedy & the mayor of the borough of Hackney should open a community hall for young people to do things. Instead of young teenagers getting recruited into crime., 19th October
item.description:
Councillor Chris Kennedy & mayor of Hackney gloating, appraising themselves about saving the bath house community center. Chris Kennedy & the mayor of hackney enjoying themselves at a day out at the sauna, spar. Councillor Chris Kennedy & mayor

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet
